description: From Latin, from Ancient Greek ξενοδοχεῖον (xenodokheîon, “place for strangers, inn”) from ξένος (xénos, “guest, stranger, foreigner”) + δέχομαι (dékhomai, “receive, accept”).

entries.meaning: A room (or separate guesthouse) in a monastery for the temporary accommodation of guests or pilgrims.
